body_html:
@dhingratul : Unfortunately, this is not well documented. I can provide some pointers though:

  • Python class that can generate a chrome trace format from StepStats is in

    tensorflow/tensorflow/python/client/timeline.py

    Line 346 in d4ad9c7

    class Timeline(object):
  • Session::Run in C++ fills in the RunMetadata proto if provided

    tensorflow/tensorflow/core/public/session.h

    Line 150 in 959f075

    virtual Status Run(const RunOptions& run_options,
  • The tracing level can be set in RunOptions -

    tensorflow/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto

    Line 417 in 08db4a7

    TraceLevel trace_level = 1;

Apologies for the lack of documentation, but hopefully the pointers help.
If you'd like to contribute documentation, that would be awesome :)

body:
@dhingratul : Unfortunately, this is not well documented. I can provide some pointers though:

- Python class that can generate a chrome trace format from `StepStats` is in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/d4ad9c73969c45d1a224ebfc43eb645b9860216b/tensorflow/python/client/timeline.py#L346
- `Session::Run` in C++ fills in the `RunMetadata` proto if provided https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/959f075558b33674c201367aef4bfc9c2dc116c4/tensorflow/core/public/session.h#L150
- The tracing level can be set in `RunOptions` - https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/08db4a7b13c18a149ded2e5c023e4267364e47d6/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto#L417

Apologies for the lack of documentation, but hopefully the pointers help.
If you'd like to contribute documentation, that would be awesome :)
